173. (L.)
Sarah Bond
, widow , was indicted for
stealing one man's cloth coat, value 5 s, one shirt, value 3 s. one box iron and two heaters, and two petticoats , the goods of
Thomas Kelley
, Mar. 20 .

Thomas Karney
. I am a watchman ; the prisoner came several times to the watch house where I belong. The last night she came she said she was destitute of work and lodging. I took compassion on her, and told her if she would go and lie with my daughter till she got work she was welcome. She took a box iron and two heaters, and pawn'd them on the 16th of March, and a coat and shirt on the 20th.

Karney. They were the property of my daughter's husband, named
Thomas Kelley
.
Q. How do you know she took them?
Karney. She would not own the coat, but the shirt was found upon her; she own'd taking the two box irons and heaters, and she has the two petticoats on her now.

Hannah Kelley
. The prisoner got up out of bed, and took away my two petticoats; she has them on her now. I saw the shirt taken out of her pocket after she was taken.
Q. from Prisoner. Did not you bid me put the petticoats on?
H. Kelley. No, I never did.
Q. from Prisoner. Did not you send me with the other things to pawn?
H. Kelley. I never sent her with a stitch of mine, only a handkerchief and apron, which she asked me to let her pawn.

Elizabeth Karney
. I am daughter in law to the prosecutor; I saw the officer take the shirt out of the prisoner's pocket, after she was taken up.
Richard Pain. I am a constable; I was sent for on the 20th of March to Karney's house, where I search'd the prisoner, and found this shirt upon her, (producing one )

Hannah Kelley
. This is my property.
